intro: Chetropis setacea, commonly known as the hairy chetropis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or riverine habitats. Chetropis setacea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some local cultures.
